description.narrative: Children in contact with the law benefit from a functional and child-friendly system of justice that protects their rights consistent with international standards.

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)

title.narrative: Iraq United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Iraq Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Adolescent Development and Participation)
Iraq Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Child Protection)
Iraq Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Overall)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children in contact with the law benefit from a functional and child-friendly system of justice that protects their rights consistent with international standards.
Number of children under ten years in the governorates affected by the ISIL occupation whose births are registered
Existence of a national J4C strategy and a costed plan of action
Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems
